question: Which of the following two statements best describes you: 'I follow INTERNATIONAL news closely ONLY when something important is happening' OR 'I follow INTERNATIONAL news closely most of the time, whether or not something important is happening'?
options: Only when something important is happening
Most of the time, whether or not something important is happening
raw_output:
I tend to follow international news most of the time, regardless of whether I think something important is happening. I find it valuable to stay informed regularly and do not wait for major events to catch up on international issues. Therefore, I align more with consistently monitoring international news rather than only when significant happenings occur.

ANSWER: B
